data.title: While holding leftMouseButton, windows get removed if rightMouseButton or Esc are pressed
data.body:
Hello,

While holding `left mouse button` over a `UI Window object` and then pressing `right mouse button` or `esc` removes the `UI Window object`.

I've made a small test demo: [https://gist.github.com/ext-1/9a15b0e9eabd8f090634c085285ece70](https://gist.github.com/ext-1/9a15b0e9eabd8f090634c085285ece70)

Also replicated on Urho3D's 02_HelloGUI sample: [https://gist.github.com/ext-1/505ce67b213a32db7761d8b15978c879#file-hellogui-cpp-L59](https://gist.github.com/ext-1/505ce67b213a32db7761d8b15978c879#file-hellogui-cpp-L59)

I guess it may be related to `SetAlignment()`. All windows with `SetAlignment()`, except the one with `SetAlignment(HA_LEFT,VA_TOP)`, seen to be affected.

Setting the windows to `SetModal(false)` didn't appear to have any effect on this issue.

Best regards.

data.title: Template primitives
data.body:
This PR turns following classes into templates:

* `Vector2` -> `BaseVector2<T>`
* `Vector3` -> `BaseVector3<T>`
* `Vector4` -> `BaseVector4<T>`
* `Rect` -> `BaseRect<T>`

Original `IntVector2`, `IntVector3`, `IntVector4` and `IntRect` were deleted.

`Vector2`, `IntVector2`, `Vector3`, `IntVector3`, `Vector4`, `IntVector4`, `Rect` and `IntRect` are defined as specializations of their respective base template classes.

A new type `IntVector4` is introduced. `Rect` can be defined from `Vector4` therefore `IntRect` needed `IntVector4` counterpart. It is not exactly necessary, but i did it for the sake of completeness.

`IntRect` now holds data in two `BaseVector2<T>` vectors `min_` and `max_`, just like `Rect`. Structs and unions were added to give access to `left_`, `top_`, `right_` and `bottom_` to both `Rect` and `IntRect`. `Rect` also gained `Width()` and `Height()` methods that were originally present only in `IntRect`.

All of these classes were provided with explicit template constructor that defines object from an array of arithmetic types.

Now these types share common code base and are of similar layout. It was very awkward to work in cases where `Rect` and `IntRect` were mixed, because of their differences in storing values. It was no less awkward to find yourself in need of a certain operator in `IntVector3` only to realize it is missing, while it is defined in `Vector3`. Now defining operator for base type will provide it to all specializations of that type. And as a bonus user can easily define his own versions of vectors that fit perfectly with the engine. `Int64Vector3` now can be a reality.

I also tested every example, including native, angelscript and lua and editor as well. Editor could use some extra testing though. I did look for features that `Int*` classes had and their `float`-based counterparts did not, but it is possible i missed something.

And that is about it. Lets hope CI will be happy 🤞

data.title: Constraints does not works when created after RigidBody
Editor Camera Improved
data.body:
1. Camera now has a virtual look-at point. Camera can now rotate around the look-at point or as well as itself. No focus will be lost during camera operation (issue #2039). New object can place at this look-at point(view center).

2. Better camera close-look - adjust pos/zoom of camera and make view frustum fit the calculated bounding box of selected nodes and components.

3. Double click component in Hierarchy Window can also look close to the node.

4. Camera smooth interpolation - pos/rot/zoom smooth interpolating for close-look, top/front/side view switching.

5. Removed MouseWheelCameraPosition to make camera less confusing. For ortho camera mode, zoom means the 'zoom' value of the camera will be changed, and for the perspective camera mode, camera distance will be changed. 

6. Key/Mouse changed - Added F key(Standard Hotkey, many popular tools use this key) and NumPad Period(Blender Hotkey) for camera close-look. Added NumPad 9 key for side view (same as NumPad 3, blender has them two). Moving middle mouse button for orbiting around look-at and right button movement for orbiting around camera itself (For standard Hotkey).

7. Some camera related code cleanup.

8. Added 'Rotate Around Selection' for supporting legacy way of camera orbiting

I wish I would find the time to fix it in Urho3D :( at least I create this issue as a reminder for me or anyone getting to fix it.

data.title: For CI - setup Clang-tidy as the linter tool
data.body: It can be configured to use C++ Core Guidelines checks. A place holder Lint build stage has been added in our primary CI configuration for a few weeks already. The Clang-tidy has an auto fix it feature, if the corresponding check support it. So, in the background we can also use this tool to check and fix our code base. Initially we will the let the warnings in the CI passed but eventually once we have configured which checks we want to enforce and after our code base has passed those checks in flying colors then a flag will be switched on to treat the warning as error. That is, PRs and commits will be subjected to those checks automatically and only accepted when they produce no errors.

data.title: fix fixtureless 2D shape scaling; fixes #2111
data.body: `ApplyNodeWorldScale` works well in the fixtureless case: it calls `RecreateFixture` which scales the shape, as expected, but ignores the fixture and the body when they are not there to start with: https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/14bdd868e8db33c2e9193ed26ac57dbca510142d/Source/Urho3D/Urho2D/CollisionShape2D.cpp#L237 and https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/14bdd868e8db33c2e9193ed26ac57dbca510142d/Source/Urho3D/Urho2D/CollisionShape2D.cpp#L215.

data.title: Scale not applied to CollisionShape2D unless it has a fixture
data.body:
CollisionShape2D does not reflect the right scale when the following sequence of operations is applied:

1. create collision shape (e.g. box) in node N
2. scale node N
3. create collision body in node N
